I run Windows 7 with the Classic theme. When being used with non-Aero themes, Firefox 4 beta and Minefield builds have a menu issue when being used on my second monitor. My primary monitor is 1920 x 1080 resolution. My secondary monitor is 1280 x 1024. Dropdown menus flicker between key inputs and show as empty (invisible) boxes with dropdown shadows applied to them.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Set Windows 7 to a non-Aero theme. Basic or Classic.
2. Set Firefox 4 to full-screen on secondary monitor.
3. Begin typing in a pre-known website address in the address bar.
Actual Results:  
The dropdown flickers between key inputs and shows as an empty (invisible) box with dropdown shadows applied to it.

Expected Results:  
A working and fully visible dropdown menu.

comments.text:
Same issue with me, Windows 7, 64, works fine in Aero mode, turn off Aero mode and URL suggestions, main Firefox menu, NoScript menu, right-click menu etc. all flicker. Rate of flicker appears directly related to mouse movement. 

Only occurs when Firefox is located on the second monitor (full screen is not relevant).

Seems to work OK if Firefox is started when in Aero mode and then Aero is turned off, but if started after Aero mode is off then the problem occurs.

Google '"Firefox 4" menu flicker' for other reports. Common "solution" is to turn off hardware acceleration.

If I move the window partially onto the primary (left) monitor, enough so the NoScript icon (which is to the left of the URL entry area) is on the primary monitor, then the flickering stops even for menus on the right hand monitor.
